info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 2:09PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Meagher County through 245 PM MDT... At 208 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of White Sulphur Springs, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Occasional lightning, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief heavy rain or snow. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Sulphur Springs, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Newlan Creek Reservoir and Fort Logan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
